title: Odisha Panchayat Election Results 2017
text:
8:02 PM IST 
There has been no voting in 13 Malkangiri booths for fear of Maoists. According to trends so far, BJD is a winner in 58 Zilla Parishad zones, BJP in 45 Zilla Parishad zones, Congress in 8 nZilla Parishad while the others in 3 Zilla Parishad zones. 7:06 PM IST 
BJP wins all 3 Zilla Parishad zones of Badamba in Cuttack. As per taly so far, the total polled seats are 174 in which BJD has won 40 Zilla Parishad zones, BJP has settled for 35 seats, Congress for 6 while the others for 2. 6:51 PM IST 
According to OTV, BJD wins 3 out of 4 Zilla Parishad zones in Balikuda of Jagatsinghpur in Odisha Panchayat elections 2017. The total polled so far is 174 out of which BJD is a winner in 33 Zilla Parishad zones, BJP wins 28 Zilla Parishad zones, Congress wins 6 Zilla Parishad while the others win 1 6:47 PM IST 
As per reports by OTV, BJD wins 3 out of 6 Zilla Parishad Zones in Bargarh. BJP makes a clean sweep in Kalahandi by winning in all 9 Zilla Parishad Zones. BJD emerges winner in 9 Zilla Parishad zones in Ganjam and 1 in Boudh. Load More Bhubaneswar, Feb 15: Counting of votes for the second phase of Odisha Panchayat Elections 2017 will begin from 1 PM onwards. However the Odisha Panchayat Election Results 2017 wonâ€™t be declared officially today. The Odisha Panchayat election results 2017 will be declared by the Election Commission on February 25. We will be updating live on counting of votes for the second phase of the Odisha Panchayat elections 2017. Stay connected with us to get latest live updates on Odisha Panchayat Election Results 2017. Polling for the second phase of Odisha Panchayat elections was held in 174 Zilla Parishad constituencies spread across 29 districts except Deogarh today. The first phase of the panchayat polls was held on February 13. The voting was conducted at 18,581 wards of 1,386 panchayats in the second phase. The poll witnessed about 71 per cent voter turnout across the state in the first phase of panchayat polls. In the first phase of Odisha panchayat elections, a total of 188 Zilla Parishad seats were contested. At least 71 per cent of the 58,28,446 voters exercised their franchise. Biju Janata Dal (BJD) claimed to win 96 seats in the first phase of polls. Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) also claimed to have won 73 seats in the panchayat polls. The five-phase Panchayat elections began in Odisha on Monday. In the 2012 Odisha Panchayat polls, the BJD had grabbed the highest 651 seats out of the total 851 Zilla Parishad seats, while Congress got 126 seats. The BJP had got third position with 36 seats. The remaining seats went to JMM (11), CPI (2), CPI (M) 1 and independent (22). The official Odisha Panchayat election results 2017 will be declared on February 25. Published Date: February 15, 2017 12:53 PM IST | Updated Date: February 16, 2017 11:57 AM IST comment Topics:
